text: Huh yeah, some of the test submissions went through
Don't think I ever saw it not throw the error though
actually is should look like :
<@U38EZFVFE> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U38EZFVFE/F7GSP0JHJ/-.js|Untitled>
small difference but it makes a difference
ah good catch, whoops
I hate having to write a normal media query
lol…
I have met people that have no idea what parts of real css and javascript actually looked like. They were just used to writing in preprocessor scripts.
WOW
I guess that is possible
I fought sass/less for a while. I still feel i can't go over to coffeescript because my js isn't 100% yet
and likely won't ever be
Yeah that is the issue. Similar to jQuery. They now how to make cool things but they don’t know why it works or what it creates.

When I taught interface design and front end dev at a local university, way back in 2005, I made 100% certain that my students understood how HTML and CSS worked so they’d understand the structural underpinnings of their design work. Most of them were visual designers so they didn’t love the idea, but the ones who got it REALLY got it.
I don’t do any actual dev any more, but I still understand the fundamentals of how it works so I can troubleshoot stuff.
Or why it isn't as fast as it could be lol
I rarely use preprocessors ... I noticed I’m actually waisting time while trying to save time :) ... or maybe I’m doing it wrong.
I think it depends on reusability. If you come up with a standard configuration it saves a lot of time. If you're creating a unique gulpfile for every project, then yeah, it's probably a net negative
that’s the issue … I cant reuse it
I've created a very basic gulp file that I load into any project now
I use the HubSpot blueprint css a lot :smile:
yeah, you can still use that. I use git on my main project.  That way I just "FORK" my base setup into a new folder
inside my git repo readme I keep the instructions of what you need to type in on the command line to get gulp working
and I have a few base variables and whatnot
things to help me with colors, some common things I use
i can check it out
and my media queries
Remind me in a few days and I'll get it into a public folder and I'll share it with whoever
I got too much stuff this week to get some of the stupid shit outta there, and then I can release it and maybe do something here to explain it to everyone
(or whoever is interested)
